key_questions:
”
When asked if the school did get him some help, Ben said, “Well I’m here, aren’t I?” States they let him
do online school for the rest of the year, which he does think helps

” “Well, I’ve been gone for what, like 6 months? That’s
certainly gonna strike a conversation with some of the kids…’hey, where have you been
?’ or whatever

What if there’s an afterlife, what if there isn’t?” When asked
what he thinks happens after you die, Ben states, “I think there’s a doorway for each religion

When asked why
he felt it was it a mistake to make the threat, Ben said, “This is going to be on my permanent record,
no?

” When
asked if he had changed his mind about the military, he stated, “Why wouldn’t I?

contradiction_map.statement_a: The "Hit List" was not seen by school staff
contradiction_map.statement_b:
the information was
corroborated through the interview process

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Staff have observed that Benjamin not only
expresses these beliefs in writing
contradiction_map.statement_b:
also encourages other students to adopt similar attitudes toward
violence

contradiction_map.statement_a:
He would babble and
sound like he was trying to say things, and could say words,
contradiction_map.statement_b: wouldn’t string together sentences

contradiction_map.statement_a: He did like his stuffed animals, would line them up
contradiction_map.statement_b:
wouldn’t act out
scenarios with them, did not engage in pretend or imaginative play

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Parents did not think much of the
behavior at the time,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
do not think he would not have noticed another’s emotions or recognized if
mom was hurt or upset

contradiction_map.statement_a:
“Ben doesn’t get angry, he just
doesn’t,
contradiction_map.statement_b: he does get frustrated with misunderstandings

contradiction_map.statement_a: Ben has peers at school that he would describe as friends,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
Rachel does not feel that they are good
influences

contradiction_map.statement_a: He is not involved in any prosocial activities,
contradiction_map.statement_b: he would like to get into theatre

contradiction_map.statement_a:
He had
been practicing for an audition and was learning the script,
contradiction_map.statement_b: dad did not take him to the audition

contradiction_map.statement_a:
She does note variations in
sleep schedule,
contradiction_map.statement_b: attributes this more to different sleep schedules between parental homes

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Denies obsessions, compulsions, repetitiveness,
CONDUCT/ODD: Mother reports Ben does not defies authority,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
he is easily annoyed, and sometimes
annoys others

contradiction_map.statement_a: FIREARMS: Ben's father, Chris, has a CPL (Concealed Pistol License)
contradiction_map.statement_b:
reports that he does not own a
gun

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Ben’s parents reported concerns about his development in language; when Ben first spoke
single words, he as about 1 year old,
contradiction_map.statement_b: did not speak in sentences until he was 3

contradiction_map.statement_a:
He has been described as intentionally provoking or
disturbing others,
contradiction_map.statement_b: this may be a maladaptive response to his own victimization

contradiction_map.statement_a: Ben does not have an Individualized Education Plan, nor a 504 plan at school,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
his parents had
requested that the school begin the 504 process about a year ago, and had brought up the 504 plan
process again to Penfield School District during the investigation of Ben’s threat

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Ben was reported to
display learning difficulties
contradiction_map.statement_b: has not been evaluated or tested for these at school

contradiction_map.statement_a:
LEGAL HISTORY: At the time of the assessment, Ben has not been had not been charged with a crime for
the threat made at school,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
the court demanded that he participate in P2P or charges could be
pressed

contradiction_map.statement_a: At first he was nervous and suspicious,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
withing several minutes he acclimated to the
interview setting and became comfortable offering information spontaneously and asking questions

contradiction_map.statement_a: Other kids were “talking crap”,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
he doesn’t remember what
they said, said he barely remembers their names

contradiction_map.statement_a: XX called Ben and a friend of his gay because they ‘side hugged’,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
both
identify as straight

contradiction_map.statement_a: Ben says it hurt him at the time,
contradiction_map.statement_b: he “thinks it’s kind of funny now

contradiction_map.statement_a: March was a low point for his mood,
contradiction_map.statement_b: states was not the lowest point

contradiction_map.statement_a: ” He believes in Christianity,
contradiction_map.statement_b: does not know what happens after you die

contradiction_map.statement_a:
” He does worry
about going to Hell
contradiction_map.statement_b: “not that much

contradiction_map.statement_a:
He was supposed to wear a patch
when he was younger to help with correction
contradiction_map.statement_b: did not

contradiction_map.statement_a:
He states that there is
a history of Ehler’s Danlos in his family (mom’s side),
contradiction_map.statement_b: his doctor said he only has hyper flexibility

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Three wishes:
• World peace – no war, no famine, no homelessness “sure there’s probably a reason that it’s
there,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
just because it’s there doesn’t mean we can’t fix it”
o Also that Hitler never existed

contradiction_map.statement_a: Note: The child endorsed the item “I think about killing myself
contradiction_map.statement_b: would not do it

contradiction_map.statement_a:
Prevent 2 Protect does not
provide direct treatment or therapy,
contradiction_map.statement_b:
instead offers case management, intensive mentoring,
systems navigation and technical assistance to promote early intervention and reduce the threat of
violence in school communities

structured_content.summary:
PSYCHIATRIC EVALUATION Date of Eval: 7/22/25
Name: Benjamin Burdette PID: C … , FACN
Child and Adolescent Psychiatrist
Diplomate of the American Board of Psychiatry and Neurology
Director Prevent 2 Protect: The Adolescent Targeted Violence Prevention Project
Associate Professor-Department of Psychiatry
Michigan State University
key_insights:
I think he said something really dumb; he has no
way of acting out

Depends on what you see when you read what I
did and think that I need to figure out what I need help with…I think I’ve been doing fine so far

” When asked
what he thinks happens after you die, Ben states, “I think there’s a doorway for each religion
“I think people that are neo nazis shouldn’t exist
Note: The child endorsed the item “I think about killing myself but would not do it
action_items: CC: Ben: “I need to figure out what I need-I was not in the right mental space

Following the discovery, a behavioral threat assessment was conducted by the building principal and
school counselor, resulting in a Level 3 Threat Behavior classification
ASD: History of developmental delay

MEDICATIONS: None ALLERGIES: NKDA
DEVELOPMENTAL HISTORY: Rachel did not use alcohol, tobacco, illicit drugs and did not take
medication while pregnant with Ben

Ben’s parents reported concerns about his development in language; when Ben first spoke
single words, he as about 1 year old, but did not speak in sentences until he was 3

Ben demonstrates a lack of social reciprocity, unusual eye contact,
lacked imaginative play, played with toys in a peculiar way (lining them up) and struggled with peer
interaction

He has significant difficulty with interpreting abstraction, nuances and
metaphoric speech
unresolved_tensions:
The "Hit List" was not seen by school staff vs the information was
corroborated through the interview process

Staff have observed that Benjamin not only
expresses these beliefs in writing vs also encourages other students to adopt similar attitudes toward
violence

He would babble and
sound like he was trying to say things, and could say words, vs wouldn’t string together sentences

He did like his stuffed animals, would line them up vs wouldn’t act out
scenarios with them, did not engage in pretend or imaginative play

Parents did not think much of the
behavior at the time, vs do not think he would not have noticed another’s emotions or recognized if
mom was hurt or upset

“Ben doesn’t get angry, he just
doesn’t, vs he does get frustrated with misunderstandings

Ben has peers at school that he would describe as friends, vs Rachel does not feel that they are good
influences
He is not involved in any prosocial activities, vs he would like to get into theatre
